definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: Lafuma added a rubber toe strip to protect you from rocks and roots.
sentences.chinese: 拉弗馬增加了橡膠腳趾地帶，以保護您的岩石和根源。

sentences.english: Metsamor lies on some of Earth's most earthquake-prone terrain.
sentences.chinese: Metsamor核電站位於地球上地震多發的地帶。

sentences.english: The swamp country is inclined to poach in winter.
sentences.chinese: 這片沼澤地帶在冬季一踏就陷下去。

sentences.english: The sea, at certain parts of the coast, goes out so far that it can no longer be seen.
sentences.chinese: 沿海有些地帶，潮落時海水退得很遠，連望都望不到。

sentences.english: The central area is characterized by many lakes, bogs and low ridges.
sentences.chinese: 中部的平原地帶以衆多的湖泊，沼澤和低嶺爲特點。

sentences.english: The so-called security zone is in the buffer zone between South and North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的聯安全地帶，也就是在南北韓之間的緩衝地帶。

sentences.english: The so-called security zone is in the buffer zone between South and North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的聯安全地帶，也就是在南北韓之間的緩衝地帶。

sentences.english: The reason for this, of course, was the fierce battle that was raging in Gaza.
sentences.chinese: 箇中緣由，自是肆虐加沙地帶的激戰。

sentences.english: It's the lushest desert on the planet.
sentences.chinese: 它是世界上最繁茂的沙漠地帶。

sentences.english: Camp David and the Eastern region in which naval business center is located in Lushun.
sentences.chinese: 而東方戴維營所處的水師營區域位於旅順的中心地帶。

sentences.english: These results have provided powerful basis for design and reconstruction of retain piles in Badu landslide.
sentences.chinese: 這爲滑坡地帶重新構築抗滑樁設計提供了理論依據。

sentences.english: Leymus chinensis and Stipa grandis are dominant species with a wide distribution in the Inner Mongolian steppes.
sentences.chinese: 羊草和大針茅是內蒙古典型草原地帶性分佈的優勢種。

sentences.english: He legislates only between gaps. He fills the open spaces in the law.
sentences.chinese: 他只是在空白處立法，他填補着法律中的空缺地帶。

sentences.english: Thus, moral gray zones enable both managers and workers to perform their roles.
sentences.chinese: 因此，道德灰色地帶使管理人員和工人都能各司其職。

sentences.english: The new road was hacked out of the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 這條新路是在叢林地帶開闢出來的。

sentences.english: From 1845, the Bund was in the British Concession.
sentences.chinese: 1845年起外灘地帶被劃爲英國租界。

definition: local/regional/district (not necessarily formal administrative unit)/region/area/as suffix to city name, means prefecture or county (area administered by a prefecture-level city or county level city)/CL:個|个[ge4]
in (some place)/to be in (adversity, a difficult situation, danger, turmoil etc)/to find oneself in/placed in/surrounded by
